IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE STUDENT INSTRUCTION, SCHOLARSHIPS AND SUPPORT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To provide student instruction, scholarships, and support.
IRS990.Description: STUDENT INSTRUCTION & SCHOLARSHIPS - AVERAGE FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT OF 482. THE COLLEGE ALSO OPERATES AN EQUINE PROGRAM.

Activity2.Description: STUDENT SERVICES - OPERATION OF STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS AS WELL AS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS.

Activity3.Description: ACADEMIC SUPPORT - OPERATION OF LIBRARY AND EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.

ActivityOther.Description: AUXILIARY SERVICES - OPERATION OF RESIDENCE HALLS, BOOKSTORE AND DINING FACILITIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The primary investment objective is to provide a sustained and increasing level of realized gain and income distribution to support the college's annual operating budget and long-range financial plans. A secondary objective is to preserve the real (inflation adjusted) purchasing power of the endowment exclusive of annual funding.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The organization draws a substantial portion of its students from a wide geographic area and follows a racially nondiscriminatory policy. Therefore, the organization is not required to publish its policy through broadcast media.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE COLLEGE RECEIVED FUNDS FROM THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AS PART OF THE COLLEGE WORK STUDY PROGRAM. THE COLLEGE RECEIVED $211,054 FROM THE PROGRAM.

FundraiserActivityInformation.Activity: Provided aid in solicitation of outside donations.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Institutional aid is provided in the form of academic scholarships, Baptist scholarships, athletic scholarships, performance scholarships, and resident assistant room discounts. The criteria for those is as follows: Academic Scholarships: Scholarships are categorized and tiered by incoming GPA and SAT/ACT scores. Student has grade maintenance requirements monitored by financial aid through the SAP process. Baptist Scholarships: Student must be a member of a Baptist Church and provide a letter from the pastor of this church. Student must maintain normal SAP requirements. Athletic Scholarship: Award is based on recommendation of the coach and coincides with other institutional aid provided. Student must comply with NAIA requirements of eligibility status and well as the school's SAP requirements. Performance Scholarship: Award is based on recommendation of the department head for the specific academic department providing the scholarship. It coincides with the academic scholarship awarded. Student must maintain SAP requirements. Resident Assistant Room Discount: Student must be selected by the Dean of Students office and must comply with the requirements of that position to receive the discount on a continual basis. All students receive a financial aid award letter detailing what aid (including institutional grants) they are eligible for. While it is not a requirement, we request that each student sign and return the letter to us within 2 weeks. Any student receiving some form of financial aid has a file as well as an electronic file maintained for them.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The CFO reviews Form 990 with the external auditors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The officers and board of trustees or their designates review the policy annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are made available upon request.
